lines.text: [Byron shows Dr. Martin the dolls he's been making]
These are not ordinary figures. The eyes were made to see. Inside each skull is a perfectly proportioned brain, perfectly capable of functioning.
You talk about them as if they were alive.
Never turn your back on a patient.
Working with the mentally disturbed... can lead to a breakdown.
If you can recognise who is - or was - Dr. Starr, then I'll consider you qualified for the position.
[Smith orders an expensive suit, but tells the tailor he can only work on the garment after midnight]
I happen to believe in astrology...
[Barbara's imaginary friend Lucy has just stabbed Barbara's brother and nurse to death]
There, Barbara, now you're free. Free of all of them.

[Having placed Ruth's dismembered body in the freezer]
Rest in pieces.
